column1: All surgeries have risks for complications.
This is more likely for people who are not healthy before surgery, who smoke or have diabetes, or who take medicines that weaken their immune systems.
These are blood clots that may form in your leg veins after surgery.
These are blood clots that may travel up to your lungs and cause serious breathing problems.
This problem is more likely in people who have diabetes or a weakened immune system.
After surgery, and often before surgery, you will learn what you can do to prevent infections in your new joint.
Joint replacement surgery relieves the pain and stiffness of arthritis for most people.
Some people may still have some symptoms of arthritis.
For most people, surgery usually provides enough relief of symptoms for most people.
